skill.author: Joseph OBrien

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation for performance analysis guidance. No executable code, no network access, no filesystem access beyond reading its own reference files, and no environment variable access. The skill provides educational content about performance optimization patterns and best practices.

content.value_statement: Applications often suffer from slow response times, high memory usage, and poor user experience. This skill provides expert guidance on identifying bottlenecks, optimizing code, conducting load tests, and improving Core Web Vitals across frontend, backend, and database layers.
actual_capabilities: Analyze application performance and identify bottlenecks
Profile memory usage and detect memory leaks
Create load test scenarios for APIs and web applications
Optimize React component rendering and bundle size
Improve Core Web Vitals (LCP, FID, CLS)
Optimize database queries and connection pooling
limitations: Does not execute code or run performance tests directly
Cannot access production systems or real metrics
Provides guidance only, requires user implementation
Does not install or configure monitoring tools

use_cases.title: Database query optimization
use_cases.description: Identify slow queries and implement indexing strategies for better database performance

use_cases.title: React rendering optimization
use_cases.description: Reduce unnecessary re-renders and optimize bundle size for faster page loads

use_cases.title: Load testing setup
use_cases.description: Create and execute load test scenarios to validate system capacity and breaking points

prompt_templates.title: Quick analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the performance of this application and identify the main bottlenecks. Suggest specific optimizations with code examples.

prompt_templates.title: Memory issues
prompt_templates.prompt: Profile the memory usage of this code and identify any memory leaks. Show how to fix them.

prompt_templates.title: Load testing
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a load test scenario for this API endpoint using k6. Include ramp-up, steady state, and peak phases.

prompt_templates.title: React optimization
prompt_templates.prompt: Optimize this React component for better performance. Apply React.memo, useMemo, and useCallback where appropriate.

best_practices: Always measure baseline metrics before optimizing
Profile to identify actual bottlenecks, do not guess
Optimize incrementally and verify improvements after each change
Set up continuous performance monitoring with alerting
anti_patterns: Over-memoizing components that do not re-render frequently
Ignoring bundle size and loading performance
Failing to clean up event listeners and subscriptions

faq.question: What tools does this skill support for load testing?
faq.answer: It covers k6, Artillery, JMeter, and Locust with examples for each tool.

faq.question: What performance metrics can be analyzed?
faq.answer: Response times, throughput, error rates, CPU and memory usage, Core Web Vitals, and database query performance.

faq.question: Can this skill integrate with my existing monitoring tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides guidance on setting up monitoring but does not directly integrate with any tools.

faq.question: Is my code data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-only skill. Your code is processed by your AI tool and never sent to external services.

faq.question: Why is my React app still slow after applying optimizations?
faq.answer: Check for issues outside React like network requests, large bundle sizes, or backend performance. Profile to confirm the actual bottleneck.

faq.question: How is this skill different from other performance tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides expert guidance and patterns rather than executing tests. It works alongside your existing tools like Chrome DevTools, k6, and Lighthouse.
